snippet: To win regulatory approval, Universal is expected to sell pieces of EMI or its own assets, but analysts are asking whether it will have to sell so much that the deal will no longer be attractive.
abstract: Universal is expected to sell pieces of EMI or its own assets to win regulatory approval of its $1.9 billion bid for EMI's record labels, but analysts ask whether it will have to sell so much that the deal will no longer be attractive; calculations show that a divestment of 10 to 15 percent of EMI's catalogs could cost Universal as much as $400 million.
lead_paragraph: To win regulatory approval, Universal is expected to sell pieces of EMI or its own assets, but analysts are asking whether it will have to sell so much that the deal will no longer be attractive.

headline.seo: Europe’s Demands Could Affect Worth of Universal-EMI Deal
headline.main: Concessions Entangle Universal’s Bid for EMI
headline.print_headline: Concessions Entangle Universal’s Bid for EMI
